Package ru.introguzzle.parsers.common.io.watch

Class FileWatcher<R extends Report>

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Thread
ru.introguzzle.parsers.common.io.watch.FileWatcher<R>
Type Parameters:
R - The type of Report generated by the watcher.
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
Direct Known Subclasses:
InspectingFileWatcher
public abstract class FileWatcher<R extends Report> extends Thread
An abstract class that monitors a specific file for changes such as creation, modification, and deletion.

The `FileWatcher` utilizes Java NIO's WatchService to listen for file system events. Subclasses must implement methods to handle events, map events to reports, handle closure, and manage errors.

      Constructs a new `FileWatcher` for the specified file path with a default thread name.
      Parameters:
      path - The path of the file to watch.

    • FileWatcher

      public FileWatcher(@NotNull @NotNull Path path, @NotNull @NotNull String name)
      Constructs a new `FileWatcher` for the specified file path with a custom thread name.
      Parameters:
      path - The path of the file to watch.
      name - The name of the watcher thread.

    • FileWatcher

      public FileWatcher(@NotNull @NotNull Path path, @NotNull @NotNull String name, @Nullable @Nullable Runnable onStart)
      Constructs a new `FileWatcher` for the specified file path with a custom thread name and an optional startup action.
      Parameters:
      path - The path of the file to watch.
      name - The name of the watcher thread.
      onStart - A Runnable to execute when the watcher starts, or null if none.

  • Method Details

    • isStopped

      public final boolean isStopped()
      Checks whether the watcher has been signaled to stop.
      Returns:
      true if the watcher should stop; false otherwise.

    • stopThread

      public final void stopThread()
      Signals the watcher to stop and invokes the close handler if not already closed. Interrupts the thread to wake it if it's blocked.

    • onClose

      public final void onClose()
      Invokes the close handler if not already closed. Ensures that the close handler is called only once.

    • getPath

      public final Path getPath()
      Retrieves the path of the file being watched.
      Returns:
      The Path of the file.

    • getReportTypes

      public Set<Report.Type> getReportTypes()
      Returns the set of file event types that the watcher is monitoring. By default, it watches for create, modify, and delete events.
      Returns:
      A set of Report.Type representing the events being watched.

    • mapper

      @NotNull public abstract @NotNull BiFunction<Path,Report.Type,? extends R> mapper()
      Maps a file path and event type to a Report object. Subclasses must implement this method to create appropriate reports for events.
      Returns:
      A BiFunction that takes a Path and Report.Type, and returns a Report.

    • eventHandler

      @NotNull public abstract @NotNull Consumer<? super R> eventHandler()
      Provides a handler to process events. Subclasses must implement this method to handle the reports generated by the mapper.
      Returns:
      A Consumer that accepts reports of type R.

    • onCloseHandler

      @NotNull public abstract @NotNull Runnable onCloseHandler()
      Provides a handler to execute when the watcher is closed. This method should return a Runnable that contains the logic to execute upon closure.
      Returns:
      A Runnable to be executed when the watcher is closed.

    • onError

      @NotNull public abstract @NotNull Consumer<? super IOException> onError()
      Provides a handler for IOExceptions that may occur during watching. Subclasses must implement this method to handle I/O errors appropriately.
      Returns:
      A Consumer that accepts IOExceptions.

    • run

      public void run()
      Starts the file watcher thread.

      This method initializes the WatchService, registers the file path for events, and enters a loop to process events until the watcher is stopped. It handles creation, modification, and deletion events for the specified file.

      Specified by:
      run in interface Runnable
      Overrides:
      run in class Thread
